intro: Borago officinalis var. stenopetala, commonly known as narrow-leaved borage, is a variant of the common borage plant. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces striking blue or violet star-shaped flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in temperate regions. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
